post_text:
Eisenhower Middle School participated in a nation-wide call to all Eisenhower-named schools to contribute a special artwork during the dedication of a new President Eisenhower Memorial located in Washington, DC. Henry Garcia (7th gr) took up the challenge this past spring by researching and by creating a stunning colored pencil drawing which focused on Eisenhower's uniform medals. We're extremely proud of Henry for representing our school during this honorable national event!

All are invited to join the virtual dedication ceremony of President Eisenhower‚Äôs Memorial on September 17th at 6:00 P.M. www.eisenhowermemorial.gov. The ceremony will also be broadcast through CSPAN. Photographs of the memorial can be viewed at :https://www.dropbox.com/sh/83k2n18z5ia0rai/AAC-7ib7vozlRs0wwgdAfDuCa?dl=0
#LPS #LawtonPS #Eisenhower Lawton Eisenhower Middle School #Art #Dedication

post_text:
Students at Woodland Hills are honoring the lives lost in the 9/11 terror attacks and Welles Crowther with Red Bandana Day. Library Assistant Mrs. Gaasbeck spent the day reading to students across the building Crowther‚Äôs story: ‚ÄúThe Man in the Red Bandana.‚Äù His heroic efforts saved many lives that tragic day.

The story and activities for the day taught them about the heroism everyday people showed on 9/11. #LPS #WeAreLPS #NeverForget911 #RedBandana

post_text:
Lawton Public Schools received a bulk of new Personal Protective Equipment thanks to the federal CARES Act allocated by Governor Kevin Stitt. Across the state, schools have received 1.7 million reusable masks, over 40 thousand face shields and over a million each of disposable gloves and gowns. LPS is thankful to the state for allocating these resources to our schools, and will put the PPE to good use this fall semester! Special thanks to the Oklahoma Emergency Management team for distributing the items and our very own Maintenance department for their assistance with the pickup.
#LPS #PPE #ThankYou #LawtonPS #WeAreLPS

post_text:
It was an AWEsome day at Almor West today! Welcome
Back. We sure have missed you.

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS
shared_text:
Almor West Elementary School
August 24 at 8:14 PM ¬∑

Our first day back was nothing short of AWEsome! We danced, we played, we listened and learned. We ate, took brain breaks and mask breaks and reconnected with our friends. We remembered to social distance while we enjoyed recess and Music and PE and lunch (and everywhere else, too). It was a great day to be a STAR! See you tomorrow, you AWEsome STARS, and we‚Äôll do it all again!!

post_text:
Check out the flyer below to learn all about our Virtual Tech Pick-up for students taking part in the virtual program! For more info about back to school plans and virtual learning, check out our FAQ: https://www.lawtonps.org/498990_3

*The times at Freedom Elementary are only available to virtual students attending that school.

FAQ:
Q: What if I already have my devices?
A: If you already have the necessary devices for virtual learning, you do not need to attend. We will work to have the schedules either e-mailed or placed on the campus portal.
Q: Are Eisenhower's phone lines still down?
A: The phone lines are currently being moved to the new building, and we will share the new number tomorrow once it is finished.
Q: Is my child's school not on the list?
A: If you're child is in our virtual program and their school is not one of the listed ones, please schedule an appointment at one of the schools in the flyer to receive your devices.
I hope this helps clear things up! Have a wonderful evening!

#LPS #LawtonPS #Virtual #Back2School

post_text:
Lawton Public Schools: Time w/Hime LPS Podcast #4

Superintendent Hime answers questions from our LPS families regarding the Return to Learn plan. Questions include modified dress code, special services and safety in the buildings.

This week, we will push out the following:
-School safety plans
-Online Check-In form for new and returning families to select the model (traditional or virtual) that they would like for their student, along with the "Return to Learn" educational options Framework.

Be on the lookout for a notification from the district. A link to the transcript of this podcast will be shared soon.

Families can enroll today to join the LPS Family by clicking this link: https://www.lawtonps.org/index.php?pageID=493267_3

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #ReturnToLearn

www.lawtonps.org/42343?articleID=57345

post_text:
"Lawton Public Schools supports the City Council's approval of the ordinance that requires the wearing of masks in public areas of our city to help reduce the spread of COVID-19.

It is important that we continue to wash our hands often, practice social distancing and cover our mouth and nose with a cloth face cover when around others. We must support the measures taken by the council to provide a safe environment for our students, staff and community members. We can do this together and make the difference today that will impact our future in a positive way!"

- Superintendent Hime
#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #CommunityCollaborations

"Lawton Public Schools supports the City Council's approval of the ordinance that requires the wearing of masks in public areas of our city to help reduce the spread of COVID-19.

It is important that we continue to wash our hands often, practice social distancing and cover our mouth and nose with a cloth face cover when around others. We must support the measures taken by the council to provide a safe environment for our students, staff and community members. We can do this together and make the difference today that will impact our future in a positive way!"

post_text:
We want to say a HUGE thank you to US Army Fort Sill's Garrison Commander and our #BOE Military Liaison Col. Don King for his leadership and service to our students and district! This was his last meeting before heading to his new duty station. We wish you and your wife safe travels and best wishes.

We also swore in our newest board member Zeldon Rice who represents LPS Area 5. In addition, Hugh Bish Elementary student Kaleb Fleming drew Woodland Hills Elementary as our July winner for the BOE's #ExtremeCurbAppealMakeover school.

#LawtonPS #WeAreLPS #LPSNextLevel
text:
We want to say a HUGE thank you to US Army Fort Sill's Garrison Commander and our #BOE Military Liaison Col. Don King for his leadership and service to our students and district! This was his last meeting before heading to his new duty station. We wish you and your wife safe travels and best wishes.

We also swore in our newest board member Zeldon Rice who represents LPS Area 5. In addition, Hugh Bish Elementary student Kaleb Fleming drew Woodland Hills Elementary as our July winner for the BOE's #ExtremeCurbAppealMakeover school.

#LawtonPS #WeAreLPS #LPSNextLevel

Each Tuesday for the remainder of the summer, the Oklahoma State Department of Education will offer free PD related to commonly used education technology tools.

This week's featured tech tool: Flipgrid. Join them at noon TODAY, July 7.

All PK-12 Oklahoma educators are welcome to attend and learn about tools that can support digital instruction for the 2020-21 school year.

View additional info & registration links here: https://bit.ly/TechToolTues

post_text:
WOW! The 1990 Eisenhower High School Eagles football team won state and national titles 30 years ago! What a great memory and achievement for our Eagles. Be sure to check out the latest issue of the 580 Monthly!

#WeAreLPS #GoEagles #WayToGoWednesday #WayBackWednesday #LawtonPS #SoarEagles #EHS #LawtonProud #580Monthly
shared_text:
580 Monthly
June 30 at 1:49 PM ¬∑

"Win or lose that title, we were gonna be bonded for life. I'll love those guys until I'm in the grave." ‚Äî Fred Thomas

Rare Birds: The incredible story of the 1990 Eisenhower football team

In 1990, they helped Eisenhower High School achieve something it never had before and hasn‚Äôt since. Not only did they win the state football championship in Oklahoma‚Äôs largest classification, they were named national champions by USA Today, who produced the foremost high school football poll during those days.

On the field, they wore opponents down with tenacity and track-star speed. But just as importantly, they were a representation of Lawton: hard-working self-starters who came from different ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds to achieve a common goal. And 30 years on, they haven‚Äôt forgotten what Lawton gave them. And Lawton hasn‚Äôt forgotten what that team gave the community.

Read Rare Birds, by Glen Brockenbush , in the latest issue of 580 Monthly , available now.

#Crafts #library #summerproject #lps
shared_text:
Lawton Public Library, Municipal City of Lawton
June 22 at 9:21 PM ¬∑

We are OUT of today's Grab & Go Craft!

Also, save your paper towel and toilet paper rolls from home to make your Paper Tube Castles on June 30th even bigger and better!

This week‚Äôs Grab & Go Craft will be Frog Prince/Princess. Bags will be available for pickup TUESDAY June 23 between 10 am ‚Äì 3 pm, while supplies last.

One bag per child ages 5-18! These are first come, first serve. We will make a post tomorrow when we run out to keep everyone updated.

Daycares need to contact us for special arrangements due to being limited on supplies. Thank you for your understanding!

Please call 580-581-3450 ext 5 for questions and curbside pickup.

This week‚Äôs Grab & Go Craft will be Frog Prince/Princess. Bags will be available for pickup TUESDAY June 23 between 10 am ‚Äì 3 pm, while supplies last.

One bag per child ages 5-18! These are first come, first serve. We will make a post tomorrow when we run out to keep everyone updated.

Daycares need to contact us for special arrangements due to being limited on supplies. Thank you for your understanding!

Please call 580-581-3450 ext 5 for questions and curbside pickup.

post_text:
#MHS has been awarded another national Promising Practice recognition for their work on Project Unified! Way to go, #Highlanders!
#WayToGoWednesday #LPS #WeAreLPS #Congratulations
shared_text:
MacArthur High School Highlanders
June 6 at 1:50 PM ¬∑

MHS is excited to announce that we have been awarded another national Promising Practice recognition for our work in Project Unified!

Project Unified give students the chance to foster relationships and promote inclusion by providing equitable opportunities for Special Olympians and unified partners to participate in athletic competitions. The students highlighted in this practice are members of Unified Club, also known as Partner's Club. Students have competed in basketball, volleyball, track and field, boccie ball, bowling, and horseshoes, to name a few.

MHS would not be capable of such a club without the guidance of club sponsors, Mr. Ford and Mrs. Santos, and the former sponsors, Mrs. Young and Ms. Ray, who spent years building this wonderful program for students of all abilities.

Congratulations to all sponsors, club members, and staff who have helped to make this organization such a huge success at MHS!
text:
#MHS has been awarded another national Promising Practice recognition for their work on Project Unified! Way to go, #Highlanders!
#WayToGoWednesday #LPS #WeAreLPS #Congratulations

MacArthur High School Highlanders
June 6 at 1:50 PM ¬∑

MHS is excited to announce that we have been awarded another national Promising Practice recognition for our work in Project Unified!

Project Unified give students the chance to foster relationships and promote inclusion by providing equitable opportunities for Special Olympians and unified partners to participate in athletic competitions. The students highlighted in this practice are members of Unified Club, also known as Partner's Club. Students have competed in basketball, volleyball, track and field, boccie ball, bowling, and horseshoes, to name a few.

MHS would not be capable of such a club without the guidance of club sponsors, Mr. Ford and Mrs. Santos, and the former sponsors, Mrs. Young and Ms. Ray, who spent years building this wonderful program for students of all abilities.

Congratulations to all sponsors, club members, and staff who have helped to make this organization such a huge success at MHS!

post_text: HEADS UP EISENHOWER FAMILIES: The pick-up date for EHS yearbooks has changed. Pick-up will now be from 4-6 p.m. on July 1 in the EHS Circle Drive.
shared_text:
Eisenhower High School Eagles
June 9 at 5:28 PM ¬∑

ü¶Öüíô New Information - Please Read üíôü¶Ö

YEARBOOK PICK-UP UPDATE: The date has changed for yearbook pick-up. Yearbook pick-up will happen from 4-6 p.m. on July 1 in the EHS Circle Drive.
If you still have a balance on your yearbook or senior ad it is due when you pick up your book. You will not be able to pick up your book if you still owe any money to EHS Yearbook.
The student must be present with some form of identification to pick-up their yearbook.
You may also purchase a yearbook at this time, but quantities are limited.
If you would like to purchase an older yearbook, they will be available to the public at this time.
If you have any questions or concerns please contact the Yearbook Adviser, Taylor Hutton, at taylor.hutton@lawtonps.org

post_text:
Members of our very own Lawton Public Schools Police Department, along with representatives of Hulen Volunteer Fire Department, Valley View Volunteer Fire Department, Cache Volunteer Fire Department, and the Comanche County Sheriff Office, participated in ALERRT Active Attack Integrated Response Training at Park Lane earlier in May.

Thank you for striving to keep our students and staff safe, always!

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #LPSPD #ALERRT #PositivePostFriday #PPF #LawtonProud

May 21 at 12:26 AM ¬∑

Edison Elementary Library 2020 Inventory! Looking back at this wild and crazy year, I am so very grateful to each and every student, teacher and support staff who made this year at Edison worth it!

Thank you Dana Milburn Moore and Ashley McCarter for your full support of the library and our students. I never take for granted your committment to our staff-YOU ARE THE BEST!

shared_text:
MacArthur High School Highlanders
May 14 at 3:30 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to Makinley Kennedy, the MHS 2020 Gene Rochelle Outstanding Senior Award winner! This award originated in 1973 and was renamed in 1982 to honor the first MacArthur principal, Mr. Gene Rochelle, who served MHS from 1969 to 1991. The recipient of this award is selected by the faculty based on his/her outstanding character traits and the tremendous contributions made while at MHS. This is the highest honor awarded by MacArthur each year. Congratulations Kiki! üíöüéìüíõ

Eisenhower High School Eagles
May 11 at 9:32 PM ¬∑

üíô‚ù§Ô∏èü¶ÖCONGRATULATIONSü¶Ö‚ù§Ô∏èüíô

The GLENN DOSSER AWARD RECIPIENT for the class of 2020 is Miss Blakelee Marco

The Glenn Dosser Award, named in honor of Eisenhower‚Äôs first principal, is being presented to the top senior at Eisenhower.

This senior has given countless hours of service to the school and community, excelled academically, has a high moral character, and has lived the mission of Eisenhower High School‚Ä¶ by promoting Integrity, Knowledge, and Excellence.

This year‚Äôs recipient of the Dick Neptune Award is Mr. Joseph Kelly

The Dick Neptune Award is named in honor of Eisenhower‚Äôs second principal. The recipient of this award is a student that has committed time and effort to making Eisenhower High School a better place, has gone above and beyond in the classroom, the school, and in the community, and exemplifies what is it to be an Eagle.

Our Eisenhower High School Eagles staff continue to show their Seniors the love and support they deserve! Not only did Seniors get to pick up their cap and gown, but they were celebrated by their teachers, coaches, and faculty members! Go EAGLES! üíô‚ù§Ô∏è

shared_text:
Eisenhower High School Eagles
May 7 at 10:24 PM ¬∑

The faculty and staff at EHS wanted to send our seniors off in style with a social distancing cap and gown parade! Students paraded through the parking lot in their vehicles and waved goodbye after picking up their cap and gowns today!! Thank you to everyone who helped make this possible!!

Check out this cover of "Hallelujah" sung by over a dozen Lawton Central Middle School students! #oklaed #LPS #LPSatHome #WeAreLPS #Hallelujah
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
hallelujah 1

CMS Lawton choir/piano is feeling blessed.
April 29 at 3:34 AM ¬∑

https://youtu.be/05aK0mPW6H8

This was a first attempt at putting Middle School students together via distance learning. Students sang into their phones from their rooms and homes. There is roughly 20 students represented in this piece. Including two soloists. Please excuse the variations in sounds and pets. We are all still figuring it out. However, These kids were wonderful to try and there are some beautiful moments. The flower pictures were taken by James E Scholz, Mrs Scholz' husband.

post_text:
LPS Class of 2020 parents: We have received several inquiries regarding the ‚ÄúAdopt-A-Senior‚Äù groups. This is not an LPS sponsored group.

Please be mindful that scammers are in these groups looking to take advantage. There are good people who want to help and others who want to cause harm.

If you want your senior to be a part of it, please do not share any personal information publicly to include your home address.

We know this is a tough time for our seniors, but please use discretion and make sure the person is who they say they are. Thank you.
text:

If you want your senior to be a part of it, please do not share any personal information publicly to include your home address.

We know this is a tough time for our seniors, but please use discretion and make sure the person is who they say they are. Thank you.

post_text: What a cool way to stay connected during distance learning! #LPS is proud to have such creative and hard working teachers! #LPSatHome #oklaed #WeAreLPS #CMS
shared_text:
Lawton Central Middle School
April 27 at 11:34 PM ¬∑

Caleb Fejeran with his 3 stickers he earned for working on his math distance learning. Galaxy, Zombie, or Rainbow sticker decals arrived by mail today to 9 students, including Caleb.
In 7th Math, Ms. Leonard is rewarding students with students if they complete 4 out of 5 sets of weekly district packet, weekly Desmos activities, or master 20 objectives on ALEKS.
If you do more than one, you get more than one sticker mailed to your door! If you are one of Ms. Leonard's 7th Math students, practice some math skills between April 6-May 8th, and fill out the form at https://forms.gle/ymVPZG1ZVyqTMjWK6
Ms. Leonard plans to mail out the second round of sticker rewards tomorrow to 13 of her other student math-letes!
Comment if you are interested in links, or more info!

shared_text:
The Great Kindness Challenge
April 6 at 11:28 PM ¬∑

Invite your students to make a new friend with our Peaceful Pen Pal project! After signing up, kids are matched with another same-aged youth and then good ol' fashioned letter writing can begin! This is a great way for students to connect AND keep their writing skills fresh! üòä

Sign Up: https://kidsforpeaceglobal.org/peacefulpenpals/

We already have over 500 kids in 37 states participating! The stories of kids' delight when their stamped letters from their new friends arrive in the mail have been SO FUN and UPLIFTING!

#LoveNow
#KidsforPeace
#GreatKindnessChallenge

Distance Learning will be different for our students and staff, but we will get through this together. Our staff is here to support our students!

If you have not been contacted by your student's teacher, please call 580-357-6900 and follow the instructions or email info@lawtonps.org with the following information:

Student's name, school, and a parent contact name and phone number. Put the SUBJECT as: "School - Name" (i.e. CMS-John Smith). We will get it shared with the appropriate school. Someone will be in contact with you. Thank you.

#LawtonPS #WeAreLPS #StaySafe #FlattenTheCurve

post_text:
If you haven't filled out the Census yet, today is the day!

It will take approximately five minutes of your time. The impact of this survey will make a difference for the next 10 years!

Go to 2020census.gov and make sure our community is not underfunded.

#WeAreLawton #CensusDay2020
shared_text:
Oklahoma State Department of Education
April 1 at 6:03 PM ¬∑

Today is Census Day! Complete the Census online in approximately five minutes or less at 2020census.gov.

The Census determines how much federal funding and services our towns, cities and schools (!) receive each year for the next decade.

Each undercounted person means an estimated $1,675 less per year (or $16,750 per person in Oklahoma over the next 10 years) in lost funding, grants and support for our communities ‚Äì so accurate representation is important!

Curious as to how much YOUR county stands to lose if citizens are undercounted? Check out the dollar figures here: https://okletscount.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Oklahoma-Census-Undercount-Cost-by-County.pdf

From the Census department: In support of guidance on what we can all do to help slow the spread of coronavirus, 2020 Census field operations will be suspended for two weeks until April 1, 2020. Families can still help out by completing the Census survey online by clicking the link below.

With the flexibility and support of the American people, we will achieve a complete and accurate count which helps guide funding decisions for things like hospitals, roads and emergency services. Respondents can also respond by calling the number provided in their invitation or by mail once they have received a paper form.

https://2020census.gov/

LPS Family: We are working as quickly as possible to provide answers to questions you have regarding the statewide school closure and impacts to our district.

We will post a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) page tomorrow and send out via text, Facebook, Twitter and our LPS website.

In the FAQ, we will address "Grab and Go" meal sites, medication pick up dates and times, testing, extracurriculars, employee pay, online resources, and special education services to name a few.

We are so proud of all our students!! Way to go, Hawks!!

Empathy, Knowledge, Outgoing

post_text:
Wondering what you can do to protect yourself and your family and friends from novel coronavirus, aka COVID-19? Your personal actions can make a difference.

Here's more information from the CDC.
shared_text:
CDC
March 4 at 3:33 PM ¬∑

Wondering what you can do to protect yourself and your family and friends from novel coronavirus, aka COVID-19? Your personal actions can make a difference.
o Wash your hands, cover your coughs and sneezes and stay away from people who are sick.
o Try to avoid someone who is showing symptoms. (This is the other side of not spreading the disease, which is not catching it.)
o If you‚Äôre 65 and older and live in areas where there is ongoing community spread, you should think about what actions you can take to reduce your exposures. http://bit.ly/CDC-COVID-19-Protect

I am a mentor because I love to see the best in people and I like being a part of molding a person into a great leader. Also the community service aspect holds a dear place in my heart.

What is your job in the program?
My job is the volunteer committee, so I help set up the events, manage the hours, and mentor participation.

What are three words to describe you?
Motivational, kind ,and outgoing

#MentorMonday #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Dr. Regina DeLoach. She has been the director of special projects for one semester, but has worked for the district for 22 years.

DeLoach‚Äôs position involves mentoring and coaching secondary teachers in effective classroom management and instruction; improving relationships with military children and Ft. Sill; creating and improving diverse community relationships; and representing Lawton Public Schools as the curriculum expert in secondary mathematics and science.

‚ÄúThe best part of my position is mentoring and coaching secondary teachers,‚Äù she said.

Dr. DeLoach believes that hard work pays off in the end.

#WeAreLPS

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet David Smith. He has been an LPS Computer Technician for 12 years.

David repairs and maintains computer hardware and software, delivers and sets up new equipment, and runs network lines, as well as many other assorted tasks.

David said the best part about his position is that he always gets to do ‚Äúsomething different,‚Äù and he gets to ‚Äúwork with some pretty fantastic people every day.‚Äù

‚ÄúI've noticed a lot of people are worried about inconveniencing us [technicians] with minor issues,‚Äù David said, ‚Äúso I can't stress enough that if you have a technology problem, don't hesitate to ask for help. I'm always happy to do whatever I can to make sure our equipment works so our educators can do their jobs without having to worry about their technology.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS
text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet David Smith. He has been an LPS Computer Technician for 12 years.

David repairs and maintains computer hardware and software, delivers and sets up new equipment, and runs network lines, as well as many other assorted tasks.

David said the best part about his position is that he always gets to do ‚Äúsomething different,‚Äù and he gets to ‚Äúwork with some pretty fantastic people every day.‚Äù

‚ÄúI've noticed a lot of people are worried about inconveniencing us [technicians] with minor issues,‚Äù David said, ‚Äúso I can't stress enough that if you have a technology problem, don't hesitate to ask for help. I'm always happy to do whatever I can to make sure our equipment works so our educators can do their jobs without having to worry about their technology.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Schyla Wright. She has been the Educational Services administrative assistant for 12 years and has been with LPS for 20 years.

Schyla works directly with the assistant superintendent of Educational Services, assists parents, teachers and principals with questions and concerns, and acts as the district point of contact for the Food For Kids Program and the LPS Christmas Food Basket Program.

‚ÄúMy favorite part about my position is knowing that I was able to help or make a difference for someone,‚Äù Schyla said.

‚ÄúIn February I will become the proud grandma of a baby boy,‚Äù Schyla said. ‚ÄúI look forward to sharing this new adventure with my family.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS
text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Schyla Wright. She has been the Educational Services administrative assistant for 12 years and has been with LPS for 20 years.

Schyla works directly with the assistant superintendent of Educational Services, assists parents, teachers and principals with questions and concerns, and acts as the district point of contact for the Food For Kids Program and the LPS Christmas Food Basket Program.

‚ÄúMy favorite part about my position is knowing that I was able to help or make a difference for someone,‚Äù Schyla said.

‚ÄúIn February I will become the proud grandma of a baby boy,‚Äù Schyla said. ‚ÄúI look forward to sharing this new adventure with my family.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS

post_text: FYI: Fort Sill will be closed Feb. 5 due to impending inclement weather. See below for more information.
shared_text:
US Army Fort Sill
February 4 at 8:07 PM ¬∑

Fort Sill is closed Wednesday Feb. 5 due to impending inclement weather. Avoid traveling on post unless absolutely necessary.

All gates will remain open.

RAHC will reschedule all appointments for Wednesday Feb 5.

All religious services are canceled.

All AAFES facilities will be closed except for the 24-hour Shoppette.

The commissary will be closed Feb. 5.

Post operations for Thursday Feb. 6 are still pending. Status for Thursday Feb. 6 will be released no later than 2:30 p.m. Feb 5.

All emergency employees will report for duty at normal times. Child and Youth Services will remain open for emergency employees only.

Emergency employees are employees who are expected to report to their worksite or begin teleworking (as permitted) on time unless otherwise directed by their agencies.

All post dining facilities will remain open Feb. 5 unless road conditions change to BLACK.

Lawton Central Middle School's 7th and 8th grade automation and robotics classes just finished their first build of the year!

Students began the semester with an introductory build of the Vex IQ Clawbot. After completing this build, students explored the built-in autonomous programs and used the Driver Controller, both wirelessly and tethered.

Word of the week Wednesday!

Integrity

‚ÄúIntegrity is the most valuable and respected quality of leadership. Always keep your word.‚Äù -Brain Tracy

Integrity is an important attribute to have when leading a crowd and is a foundation of character. Along with this comes the consistency of our actions, morals, and principles. It means to do what is right no matter when, where, or who is watching or present.

#wordoftheweekwednesday
#ikeignition #Lead4Change

All of our Central Oklahoma Region 14 Spelling Bee participants did incredibly well today!

Congratulations to Austin Bartek from Lawton Eisenhower Middle School for winning and Austin Davis from Pat Henry Jaguars for being runner-up! Both participants will compete at the State Spelling Bee on Feb. 29 in OKC. And both will represent LPS well!

In case you missed it, watch the spelling on our YouTube page: https://youtu.be/mHTK7KjHrws

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet SGT Jimmy Gallaher. He has been a K-9 Officer with the LPS Police Department for about a year and a half.

Gallaher‚Äôs main priority is to ensure the safety of everyone in the district, with an emphasis on overseeing and managing elementary School Marshals and K-9 Patrol.

‚ÄúThe best part about my position is being able to help out and respond to calls in the district,‚Äù he said.

Gallaher said he would like others to know he always tries to be a team player and work hard, no matter what the job or circumstance is.

#WeAreLPS

post_text:
Eisenhower Middle School's agricultural education class had a hands-on learning experience this morning. LPS teacher Lindsey Hoerbert and her husband Kasey brought their family horses to EMS for students to pet and feed. This is part of the 8th grade capstone where students learn about the agricultural livestock industries. For some students, this was their very first time interacting with a horse! Tomorrow they will travel to the school farm to re-visit the sheep and pigs being raised there through the agricultural education program.

#WeAreLPS #EMS #LawtonPS #AgEd

The Infant Crisis Services BabyMobile will be in Lawton from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.on Jan. 22 at the Comanche County Health Department.

This mobile formula, food, and diaper pantry, will provide assistance to parents of children from birth through age three.Parents will receive:

One week supply of diapers, formula for a week. a pack of toddler food (depending on age), a bottle and a pack of wipes
Please review the requirements on the linked website.

#WeAreLPS

Word of the Week Wednesday

Relationship - the way in which two or more concepts, objects, or people are connected, or the state of being connected.

"The best thing to hold onto in life is each other."
‚Äî Audrey Hepburn

Having a good relationship with your fellow mentors is one of the keys things that help our program thrive. In this program we do a lot of big things in our community and in our school that could never be accomplished without us having good relationships with our fellow mentors

#WordofTheWeekWednesday #IKEIgnition
#Lead4Change

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet AJ Watson. He has been the Director of Information Technology for two years and has been with LPS for 10 years.

AJ primarily focuses on helping teachers, students and staff with all technology issues, with the help of his Computer Technician team. AJ also plans technology projects and deployments.

‚ÄúThe best part about my position is being a part of the solution to a problem that is causing staff or students stress or keeping them from doing what they want or need to do with technology,‚Äù AJ said. ‚ÄúA few years back, I would say it would be after installing a projector and a student said ‚ÄòIt's upside down‚Äô as the picture showed up for the first time.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to help,‚Äù AJ said, ‚Äúand when I can [help], it‚Äôs the greatest part about my job.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS
text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet AJ Watson. He has been the Director of Information Technology for two years and has been with LPS for 10 years.

AJ primarily focuses on helping teachers, students and staff with all technology issues, with the help of his Computer Technician team. AJ also plans technology projects and deployments.

‚ÄúThe best part about my position is being a part of the solution to a problem that is causing staff or students stress or keeping them from doing what they want or need to do with technology,‚Äù AJ said. ‚ÄúA few years back, I would say it would be after installing a projector and a student said ‚ÄòIt's upside down‚Äô as the picture showed up for the first time.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm here to help,‚Äù AJ said, ‚Äúand when I can [help], it‚Äôs the greatest part about my job.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS

post_text: #WeAreLPS #OklaEd
shared_text:
Oklahoma State Department of Education
January 10 at 4:39 PM ¬∑

State Superintendent Joy Hofmeister shines a light on the needs and accomplishments of Oklahoma's Native American students this morning at the Inter-Tribal Council general session in Catoosa: "I remain passionate in my commitment to meaningful collaboration between public schools and all Tribal Nations."

Supt. Hofmeister also shared the following:

* Oklahoma's Native American students have already achieved top 10 status for graduation rate in the nation when compared to their peers.

* In the past 6 years, the number of Native languages eligible for high school graduation credit has risen to 10. "We are committed to strengthening schools that teach Native languages."
text:
#WeAreLPS #OklaEd

January 10 at 4:39 PM ¬∑

State Superintendent Joy Hofmeister shines a light on the needs and accomplishments of Oklahoma's Native American students this morning at the Inter-Tribal Council general session in Catoosa: "I remain passionate in my commitment to meaningful collaboration between public schools and all Tribal Nations."

Supt. Hofmeister also shared the following:

* Oklahoma's Native American students have already achieved top 10 status for graduation rate in the nation when compared to their peers.

* In the past 6 years, the number of Native languages eligible for high school graduation credit has risen to 10. "We are committed to strengthening schools that teach Native languages."

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Dawn Tillman. She has been with the LPS Police Department for about a year and has been in the law enforcement field for 11 years.

Officer Tillman upholds her duty to protect life and property. She helps maintain order and security across the district for LPS students and staff.

‚ÄúThe best part about my position is watching students grow and mature throughout their time in school, and the people I work with,‚Äù she said.

Officer Tillman loves to laugh and making other people laugh. If she can make someone laugh, she considers it a good day.

#WeAreLPS

The Lawton High School Cheerleading Squad is reaching out to Elementary School students with a cheer clinic this Saturday! Registration will begin at 8:45 a.m with the clinic running from 9-11 a.m.

If you have any questions you can contact Coach Kylee Montgomery at kylee.montgomery@lawtonps.org or 580-355-5170 ext. 3391

#WeAreLPS #LHS #Wolverines #CheerSquad #NewYearNewCheer #CheerClinic
shared_text:
Lawton High School Wolverines
January 7 at 2:46 PM ¬∑

The Lawton High Cheerleading squad would like to invite elementary aged students to our cheer clinic this Saturday, January 11th.

Registration will begin at 8:45 a.m with the clinic running from 9 a.m.-11 a.m.

Students attending the clinic will learn cheers and a routine they will perform at halftime of the Lawton High vs. Putnam City basketball game on Jan. 17th

Participants will also receive free admission to the basketball game and a T-shirt.

Please wear athletic clothing and tennis shoes to the clinic.

If you have any questions you can contact Coach Kylee Montgomery at kylee.montgomery@lawtonps.org or 580-355-5170 ext. 3391

There‚Äôve been a lot of reasons to celebrate recently at Almor West and this is one of the latest: Just before winter break, Almor West was awarded a very generous $2,000.00 grant from WalMart to aid us in developing a sensory room for our students. post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Joshua Seely. He has been a Lieutenant and patrol supervisor for the LPS Police Department for two years and has been with the department for three years.

Seely‚Äôs responsibilities include investigations, SIBR entry and validation, he is the LPSPD training coordinator, he tracks officer absences, he manages duty roster assignments, and other law enforcement duties.

‚ÄúThe best part about my position is working with the other officers and getting to share my experiences in law enforcement.,‚Äù he said.

Seely would like others to know that he enjoys ‚Äúspending time with family and friends.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS

Lawton High School Wolverines
December 10, 2019 at 7:46 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to the winners in the 2019 LaSill Optimist Essay Contest. Taking first place was junior Tre Whalen. Second went to junior Nathaniel Bowman, and tied for third were junior Kiari Gosha and sophomore Liz Vazquez Rivera. The theme was "Is Optimism the Key to Achieving the Dreams You iMagine?" The students and their parents will be honored at a supper at Asian Buffet on 12 December. The students will receive cash awards.

post_text:
Meet Amya! ü¶Ö

#WeAreLPS #IKEIgnition #LawtonPS #Lead4Change #TerrificTuesday
shared_text:
Ike Ignition
December 10, 2019 at 12:14 AM ¬∑

This weeks mentor of the week is Amya Nunley!

Why are you a mentor?
I am a mentor because I wanted to do what I can to make my freshmen feel how I felt last year and prevent them from making bad, life changing decisions.

What is your job in the program?
In this program, I am a part of the Lesson Planning Committee. I help create lessons that the mentors teach our freshmen each Friday and I love it.

What are three words to describe you?
Caring, helpful, bright
#MentorMonday #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change

Lawton Public Schools added 16 new photos.
November 19, 2019 at 2:57 PM ¬∑

MacArthur High School (MHS) students and LPSPD officers organized the 2019 Red Tulip Project, which took place throughout October. This project's purpose was to raise baby items, such as diapers, wipes, clothes and toys to donate to DHS. Donations were collected at most schools around the district and compiled at MHS, where students sorted the supplies into care packages. In the case of an emergency foster, the hosting parents would receive a care package from DHS as a starter supply kit for the baby they will foster.

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #RedTulipProject #LawtonProud #TerrificTuesday

#WeAreLPS #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change #LawtonPS #TerrificTuesday #Eagles
shared_text:
Ike Ignition
November 19, 2019 at 1:45 AM ¬∑

This week‚Äôs mentor of the week is Spencer Short!

Why did you become a mentor?:
I became a mentor due to my freshman year. I was quiet, shy, and barely had anyone to talk with or relate to until my mentors came into our class. After that, I wanted to help other students who were like me know that they aren't alone

What is your job in the program?:
My job is with the volunteer committee. I help put stuff together and organize volunteer times.

What are three words to define you?:
Kind, creative and caring.

#MentorMonday #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change

Meet the #IKEMentorOfTheWeek, Lorishia! üíôü¶Ö

#WeAreLPS #IKEIgnition #LawtonPS #LawtonProud #EaglesSoar
shared_text:
Ike Ignition
November 5, 2019 at 3:16 PM ¬∑

This week‚Äôs mentor of the week is Lorishia Naputi!

Why are you a mentor?: I am a mentor because Ignition allows me to amplify my interest of helping others, such as my kids, and anyone who is willing to learn and grow. I love how we are always on the move and are always thinking about what next we can do to benefit our community and our school.

What is your job in the program?: My job in the program is Public Relations/Social Media. I‚Äôm in charge of Ignition‚Äôs Instagram page. I help publicize all that Ignition does to help our community and our school, such as the activities and events we hold.

What are 3 words to describe you?:
Determined, honest, and Collaborative

#MentorMonday #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change

UPDATE: Due to potential for bad weather, the competition has been postponed to Tuesday, Nov. 5.

Good luck to our #MacBand as they head to the Oklahoma Secondary School Activities Association (OSSAA) Regional Marching Band competition tomorrow!

Shout out on their recent achievements:
Hub City Invitational - First place in 5A and Superior ratings
Konawa Band Day - First Place in 5A; second highest score
out of 25 bands. The band received the Outstanding Drum Line award. Band members had to march in a downpour of rain‚Äîthe only band that did so. The rain appeared to start and end with the band‚Äôs notes.

If you are in the Yukon area, be sure to join the Highlander football team and leadership class as they show their support for the Mac band members with a wave of green, black and gold in the stands!

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #GoBigMac

post_text:
Lawton Public Schools educators from across the district are spending a few days at the Character.org National Forum!

This character development conference is the largest character development conference in the world. It's an opportunity to learn best practices and understand the latest research in character development in the classroom, the office, the sports center, and the home.

Staff have taken advantage of the sessions to include Tribal Storytelling. Tribal storytelling focuses on human connection- teachers connecting with students through storytelling. The speaker asked for volunteers and randomly picked one from each of our high schools!

Way to go Ms. Rust, Mr. Hale, and Ms. Hilliary!!

#WeAreLPS #FeelGoodFriday #LawtonPS
text:
Lawton Public Schools educators from across the district are spending a few days at the Character.org National Forum!

This character development conference is the largest character development conference in the world. It's an opportunity to learn best practices and understand the latest research in character development in the classroom, the office, the sports center, and the home.

Staff have taken advantage of the sessions to include Tribal Storytelling. Tribal storytelling focuses on human connection- teachers connecting with students through storytelling. The speaker asked for volunteers and randomly picked one from each of our high schools!

Way to go Ms. Rust, Mr. Hale, and Ms. Hilliary!!

#WeAreLPS #FeelGoodFriday #LawtonPS

post_text:
This #FeelGoodFriday, we want to recognize the Indigenous People's Day Planning Committee for their recent donation to our LPS Homeless Education program.

Members of the committee who organized the donation, Martina Callahan and Danna Key, dropped off the donations at the Douglass Office earlier this week.

The donation included socks, undies, hygiene items and a monetary donation for the purchase of hygiene items in the amount of $ 80.00.

We appreciate donations like these as we can give them out immediately to our students in need.

We want to thank our community partners and community organizations in the name of our students for reaching out.

#CommunityCollaborations #WeAreLPS #LawtonPS
text:
This #FeelGoodFriday, we want to recognize the Indigenous People's Day Planning Committee for their recent donation to our LPS Homeless Education program.

Members of the committee who organized the donation, Martina Callahan and Danna Key, dropped off the donations at the Douglass Office earlier this week.

The donation included socks, undies, hygiene items and a monetary donation for the purchase of hygiene items in the amount of $ 80.00.

We appreciate donations like these as we can give them out immediately to our students in need.

We want to thank our community partners and community organizations in the name of our students for reaching out.

#CommunityCollaborations #WeAreLPS #LawtonPS

#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Sherry Havron. She is an Assistant Director of Elementary Curriculum for LPS, and has worked for the district going on 40 years.

Her main duty is to provide support to elementary principals and teachers in curriculum and instruction.

Sherry said the best part about her job is the ‚Äúamazing interactions with her peers and colleagues‚Äù, as well as ‚Äúvisiting school sites to watch teaching and learning in action.‚Äù

‚ÄúEducation is in my blood,‚Äù Sherry said. ‚ÄúEvery female member in my family is an educator‚Äîthat‚Äôs four generations.‚Äù

shared_text:
Almor West Elementary School
October 7, 2019 at 1:39 AM ¬∑

Our coin drive fundraiser for our new sound system continues this week until WEDNESDAY. If we raise $300.00 (all classes combined), Ms. Bowman will spend the entire day Thursday (Oct. 10) on the roof of the school! If you joined us for BINGO night Friday, you know first hand how desperately we need a new sound system. Our goal is completely attainable if every class raises just $20.00. :-) The class with the highest total contribution will earn a special reward from Mrs. Thomas. :- ) Thank you for always supporting our efforts for our kiddos!

post_text:
UPDATE (12:35 p.m.): LPSPD has identified and isolated the suspect who made threats to Central Middle School last night via social media.

The suspect is currently under arrest and in law enforcement custody. Upon detainment of the suspect, there is no longer a threat to students or staff.

We cannot share any other details at this time as we are limited to by federal law. Please know that all threats will be handled swiftly and immediately. We want to thank the parents and students that reported this information.

We ask that anyone, parent or student, who sees any potential threat at any time to please report it to LPS administration or law enforcement immediately.

**************************************

CMS parents: We are aware of the threat sent last night via social media. Law Enforcement is actively working to verify the threat. Classes will be session today (10/7). Please know we will have extra security in place today to ensure the safety of your student. Thank you.
text:

The suspect is currently under arrest and in law enforcement custody. Upon detainment of the suspect, there is no longer a threat to students or staff.

We cannot share any other details at this time as we are limited to by federal law. Please know that all threats will be handled swiftly and immediately. We want to thank the parents and students that reported this information.

We ask that anyone, parent or student, who sees any potential threat at any time to please report it to LPS administration or law enforcement immediately.

post_text:
Peloton, a company who specializes in producing engaging home fitness equipment, loves to hear about comeback stories. Each month, they select 50 inspiring "Comeback" stories and donate a Peloton Bike, a 3-year subscription to classes, and the "Essentials" accessories package to support their comebacks.

LHS athletic director and athletic trainer David Stanley was a fortunate recipient of a Peloton Bike. Click the link below to read about his encouraging Comeback experience!

#WeAreLPS #LawtonPS #Comeback #Peloton #LawtonProud #Grind #PelotonBike #LHS #Wolverines #HantaYo

post_text:
#WhoAreWeWednesday

Meet Christy Kellett. She is a Human Resources Secretary for LPS, and has worked for the district for 16 years.

Christy helps to in-process all certified employees for the district‚Äîshe ensures that all are certified in the area in which they are teaching, among other things.

‚ÄúThe best part of my position is meeting new people,‚Äù Christy said. ‚ÄúCalling to offer them a new career at LPS has to be the best part. I love helping them in any way I can to make their job easier.‚Äù

‚ÄúI have a huge heart for people,‚Äù Christy said. ‚ÄúI believe that everyone has potential and room to grow, but we all need a little help along the way.‚Äù

#WeAreLPS

post_text:
Meet Caleigh She is the other Ike Ignition Mentor of the Week. üëçüôÇ

#WeAreLPS #MentorMonday ##LawtonPS #EHS #IKEIgnition
shared_text:
Ike Ignition
September 30, 2019 at 3:07 PM ¬∑

This week‚Äôs mentor of the week is Caleigh James

Why are you a mentor?:
I am a mentor because I love being there for the freshman and giving them someone to depend on especially when there may not be anyone for them. I love seeing them grow as people every week because of the lessons we teach them.

What is your job in the program?:
I am a part of the PR Social committee. We create posts for our social medias. We also do interviews when KSWO or any local news outlet comes to our school.

What are 3 words to describe you?
Determined, Energetic, and Loving

#MentorMonday #IKEIgnition #Lead4Change

shared_text:
Hungry Hearts Feeding Ministry
September 26, 2019 at 3:38 PM ¬∑

We are SUPER EXCITED to announce Hungry Hearts has received a grant from Walmart Lawton - NW Quannah Parker Trl through the Walmart Giving program! With that being said, we will be taking a portion of this donation and using it to kick-off THE SNACK DRIVE. All items collected during this Drive will go to the students of Lawton Public Schools . Thank you to Walmart for your amazing donation and thank you to the awesome businesses that volunteered to be donation sites, Good Vibes Nutrition, The Bent Fork Catering, Leo & Ken's Truck Stop & Restaurant, and 5 Star Nutrition. With everyones help, we look forward to making a great contribution to LPS!

The the MacArthur Highlanders and the Lawton High Wolverines faced off on Sept. 13 to kick off week two of the 2019 high school football season at Cameron Stadium. Big things happened, as the Lawton athletic foundation presented a check that will go too all three high school athletic programs. Additionally, MHS celebrated their 50th year anniversary. We are proud of the hard work and dedication from our football players, trainers, band members, dancers, cheerleaders, coaches and fans!

text:
Congratulations to EHS sophomore Cathlien Spangle for receiving the Leo of the Year award from Lions Club International. Cathlien is one of 16 in the nation that received this award!

#WeAreLPS #LionsClub #LawtonProud #LawtonPS #LeoOfTheYear

Happy Saturday! If you don't know how to turn off your utilities in a disaster or emergency, take some time today to research it.

"Learn how to turn off utilities like natural gas in your home. ready.gov/safety-skills #PreparedNotScared #BeReady" -Ready.gov
